byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

abstract: Courtship by Islamic State of Hassan Aboud, who defected from Syrian rebels to join them in 2014, offers window into militant group's recruitment process, belying their claims that those who join up are driven only by piety or by desire to defend themselves; Aboud has been promoted to commander who directs network of assassins, and his former neighbors and associates say he was drawn to Islamic State by promise of money, power and allure of violence (Series: State of Terror).
lead_paragraph: Since the Syrian rebel leader Hassan Aboud joined ISIS, taking with him fighters and weapons, he has been behind a sprawling mix of battlefield action and crime.

headline.main: Behind the Black Flag: The Recruitment of an ISIS Killer
